alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Northern Phillips; Northern Valley; Southwest Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 31 at 1:41PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following areas, Central and Southeast Phillips, Central and Southern Valley, Garfield, Northern Phillips, Northern Valley, Petroleum and Southwest Phillips. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Continued warm temperatures, plentiful moisture from the Pacific Ocean, and repeated storm systems moving into our region will allow efficient rain showers and scattered thunderstorms to prevail across the area through the latter part of this week. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Those planning outdoor activities should monitor the latest forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Garfield; Northern Phillips; Northern Valley; Southwest Phillips
